comments.body: Don't like the signature for a public function. How about making `fd` public above and then use `func IsTerminal(fd Fd) bool`?

This is how you the code was before. It's used by OpenShift and we pass in
things like io.Reader. Take a look at where we use it downstream.

On Friday, July 15, 2016, Dr. Stefan Schimanski notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In pkg/util/term/term.go
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/28964#discussion_r70931829
> :
> 
> >  }
> > 
> > -// isTerminal returns whether the passed object is a terminal or not
> > -func isTerminal(i interface{}) bool {
> > +// IsTerminal returns whether the passed object is a terminal or not
> > +func IsTerminal(i interface{}) bool {
> 
> Don't like the signature for a public function. How about making fd
> public above and then use func IsTerminal(fd Fd) bool?
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/28964/files/792ec603c0ac6891c4c547ce4cbefcc3101503d4#r70931829,
> or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAABYlZKHNW8iAer9mIjW5mi-k6-iZsTks5qVzb9gaJpZM4JMn10
> .
fine with me, although it won't win the award for good go code
Lots of things that don't share a common interface can be a terminal.
in fact it does more now with resizing. The comment only mentions `Safe`.
Separate this from the other fields by a newline to delineate private / public.
If Out is optional this must be null.
If `t.Out` is nil, this will return false, won't it?
